results.title: The Game
results.creator_credit: George Kaczender, John Kemeny and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This is the boy-meets-girl game, but played without rules and at a time when the boy must prove himself in the chase. It is about the much-discussed sexual behavior of teenagers and shows that often the game starts with a challenge to his masculine ego from the boy’s peer group. Few adults are seen or heard from, nor does the film take sides in this game. A dramatisation.
results.creator_credit_for_label: George Kaczender, John Kemeny and National Film Board of Canada
results.description: This is the boy-meets-girl game, but played without rules and at a time when the boy must prove himself in the chase. results.title: The Hen = La Gallina
results.brief_description: Shows the habits and behaviour of a flock of hens and roosters, and close-ups of their physical features. They are seen feeding, and their behaviour within a group is shown, including calling to each other and fighting. In Italian - no subtitles.

results.title: A Future for the past
results.creator_credit: Peter Bradford and World Wide Pictures
results.brief_description: Considers action to prevent the erosion of character in Britain’s historic towns and villages. Old photographs, live action and superimposed animation explain why and how towns change and what has been done and might be done in the future in areas worthy of conservation.
results.description: Considers action to prevent the erosion of character in Britain’s historic towns and villages. Old photographs, live action and superimposed animation explain why and how towns change and what has been done and might be done in the future in areas worthy of conservation.

results.title: Fungus plants
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and ERPI Classroom Films
results.brief_description: Emphasis is given to the various mushrooms whose growth and reproduction are illustrated by time-lapse photography and animation. Moulds and other fungi are also presented by these same techniques. Their economic importance is indicated.

results.title: Fundamentals of photography: light sensitive materials
results.brief_description: This film discusses the physics of light and colour; shows how light-sensitive materials may be classified according to their light sensitivity; explains the composition of such light-sensitive materials.

results.title: Fun radio!
results.brief_description: A casual glance at the Australian summer weekend. A troupe of pop singers is greeted at the airport by a large crowd. In the suburbs people are seen at their homes. Life in Melbourne is seen as a great religious festival, complete with rituals, taboos and minor deities.

results.title: Fun factory
results.creator_credit: Saul J. Turell, Paul Killiam and Sterling Educational Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “History of the Motion Picture”.
This film tells of Mack Sennett’s rise from movie extra to king of comedy. It also looks at the style and the actors of the Mack Sennett studio, famous for its “Keystone Cops” films. Uses excerpts from films of the period.

results.title: Full circle: the work of Doris Chase
results.creator_credit: Doris Chase, Elizabeth Wood and Perspective Films
results.brief_description: Documentary on painter, sculptor and filmmaker, Doris Chase. Ms Chase explains her work including the development of her sculptural furnishings for modern dance groups into video film works.
